alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Martin, Floyd and western Pike Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cliff to Dorton. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Allen, Lancer, Corn Fork Hollow, Emma, Alvin, Dwale, Beaver Junction, Allen City, Banner and Arkansas around 505 PM EDT. Prestonsburg, Dicks Creek and Endicott around 510 PM EDT. Rockhouse around 515 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Elkhorn City, Garden Village, Marrowbone, Shelbiana, Pleasant, Belcher, Cedarville, Fishtrap Lake, Chloe, Raccoon and Zebulon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
